intro: Atractocarpus tenuiflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered atractocarpus, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
